page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: This rural area lies midway between Wirksworth and Ashbourne, just outside the Peak District National Park. The land surface lies between 180 metres and 276 metres above sea level, and is bisected by Havenhill Dale Brook. It is predominantly a farming area, where most of the land is enclosed and is used for sheep and dairy farming. The farms are scattered. The village of Bradbourne undoubtedly provided a social centre in the past, but increased mobility has meant that the village has become progressively less important for local inhabitants. Houses in the village are being bought up by commuters and holiday-makers, and the area's character is changing as a result of this. The area is unspoilt by industrial development. Its limestone hills and dales make it very beautiful.
